sentences.en: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.cn: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.en: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.cn: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

sentences.en: Bournemouth, you have to admit, has style.
sentences.cn: 你不得不承认伯恩茅斯是个很有格调的地方。

sentences.en: I admit I was foxed for some time.
sentences.cn: 我承认我一度被难住了。

sentences.en: I admit to being congenitally lazy.
sentences.cn: 我承认自己生性懒惰。

sentences.en: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes.
sentences.cn: 我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

sentences.en: I hate to admit it, but you were right.
sentences.cn: 我不得不承认，你是对的。

sentences.en: I have to admit that I have bad handwriting.
sentences.cn: 我不得不承认自己的字写得不好看。

sentences.en: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.cn: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.en: I must admit I like looking feminine.
sentences.cn: 我得承认我喜欢看起来淑女一些。

sentences.en: I must admit that maps obsess me.
sentences.cn: 我得承认我对地图十分着迷。

sentences.en: I must admit, I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.cn: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.en: None of these people will admit responsibility for their actions.
sentences.cn: 这些人都不会愿意为自己的行为负责。

sentences.en: Only ticket-holders will be admitted into the stadium.
sentences.cn: 只有持票者才可进入体育场。

sentences.en: Owners of restaurants would have to equip them to admit disabled people.
sentences.cn: 餐厅老板将必须在餐厅里配备能够接纳残疾人的设施。

sentences.en: The Parachute Regiment could be forced to admit women.
sentences.cn: 伞兵团可能会被迫招收女性。

sentences.en: The two men were far more alike than they would ever admit.
sentences.cn: 那两个人也许不承认，可他们非常相像。

sentences.en: They admit they are now desperate for a lucky break.
sentences.cn: 他们承认现在急盼幸运之神的降临。

sentences.en: Women are often ashamed to admit they are being abused.
sentences.cn: 妇女对受到的侵犯常常羞于承认。

sentences.en: You have to admit that you are, in fact, in difficulties.
sentences.cn: 你不得不承认，你事实上是陷入了困境。

words.tran_cn: 可容许的；可采纳的；可接受的
承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

trans.tran_cn: 承认，招供，准许…进入，接纳，收治
trans.tran_en: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

trans.tran_cn: 承认； 接纳， 准许…进入
trans.tran_en: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
